text: Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana kremowa, drobna, dość obfita, utrzymuje się na powierzchni, zostawia średni lacing. W zapachu karmel, czekolada, figi, rodzynki, wanilia. W smaku czekolada, karmel, drewno, wanilia, rodzynki, paloność. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie, posmak karmelowy, palony.

Bottle at home. Opaque black with a thin tan head. Complex aroma of tar, fruit, old tobacco and a hint of wood. Tastes bitter - very bitter. Peaty, woody, fruity and tar-like with a dry finish and a hint of smooth vanilla. Definitely a hint of whisky. Complex, interesting and worth trying.
Bottle. Pours almost black with a tan head. Aroma of roast, heavy licorice, dry Barre l, slight phenolic, loads of wood. Fruity with loads of barrel, fruity and quite dry.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2017 330 ml bottle from Amazon. Aroma is sweet with smoky whisky tones and hints of caramel/chocolate and coffee. Dark beige head and black body. Taste is sweet with caramel tones and smoky whisky, and there is a subtle wooden taste as well. Leaves a long, smoky aftertaste. A very rich beer overall. One is enough for sure.

Black color, small brown head. Sweet aromas of caramel, kolasnören, raisins, wood, syrup, slight smoke and chocolate. Taste of caramel, wood, whisky, salt, smoke, chocolate and roasted malt. Really good.

Tasted on 31.03.15. Intensive aroma of chocolate and liqueur candies. Small head disappearing to ring. Almost completely black colour. Complex taste of dark chocolate and liqueur candies. Great hoppy and roasted bitterness perfectly balances sweetness.

33cl bottle split with my housemate. Appearance: black with low egg-shell white head. Aroma: smoke, Lays Hamkas, mocca, coffee, raisins, whisky. Taste: high sweetness and low bitterness. Notes of coffee, whisky, mocca, raisins. Finish is fairly long and filled with smoke / Lays Hamkas. Palate: full bodied, thin oily texture and soft carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2017 Pours oily black with tan beige head. Aroma: roasted grain, peat, hint of smoked, dark malts, dark fruit esters, hint of vanilla & whisky. Flavour follows aroma: roasted grain, malt with toasted toffee, caramel, chocolate, coffee like charackter, peat, smoked, dark fruit esters, whisky, tobacco, leather, hint of vanilla. Dry, slightly peated finish. Medium body, soft texture, moderate carbonation.

From 11.2oz bottle to snifter. Pour is a dark brown/black color, no head. Nose is roasted malt, smokey, licorice, toasty, whisky. Taste is medium-heavy bodied, sweet with touches of bitterness. Finishes super silky.

Bottle (330 ml) at home. Bottled July 2011, so nearly 6 years old now. Dark brown, almost black, with a small beige head, decent retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is nicely peaty and smokey with roasted malt, berries, caramel and tobacco. Taste is slightly sweet but not cloying with peat aplenty, smoke, berries, caramel, roasted malts, hints of alcohol and tobacco notes. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Peaty finish. Surprisingly well balanced considering the peat presence which isnt easy at all. Still in pretty good shape for a 6 years beers, I would never have known it was that old without looking at the bottle. Really flavorful.

Flaske 0,33L via DjOeye. Aroma plomme, karamell, malt. Utseende sort med lite beige skum. Smak karamell, malt, mørke frukter, lakris. En kraftig øl med lang ettersmak med noe lakris, føles noe tynnere mot slutten

---

Bottle. Pours black with thin tan head that dissipates quickly. Nose of caramel, coffee, and smoke. Chocolate and caramel with smoke in the long finish. Medium body; not as viscous as expected. Alcohol less prevalent than expected as well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark, brown color. Nice , beige head. Burned sugar, wood, cocoa and hint of smoke in aroma. Flavor of dried fruits, whisky and cocoa. Sweet and malty . Smooth, warming finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Black with small beige head. Aroma is wood, medium body, low carbonation, and a little lacing. Taste is rich tobacco, wood, and a little chocolate.  Seems to be real similar to 16 year old.
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2017 Cocoa and rich booze. Boozy scent of whiskey and malts. Taste is a bit sweet and thick. Very nice and smooth. Better as it warms. Bottle.

Bottle. Dark brown close to black with a small light brown head with good lace and regeneration. Nose has dark wood, tobacco, burned sugar, light earthy smoke. The flavour follows with earthy smoke, chalk, dark wood, twigs, light brown sugar. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet with mild bitterness. Long finish with brown sugar, tobacco and light smoke.

0.33 l bottle from Marktkauf Nowak (Iserlohn), bottled in April 2015, 8.0% abv. Black with a thin, soapy, slowly diminishing, beige head. Sweetish, slightly roasty-malty, a bit smoky and minimally medicinal aroma of lots of whisky, dark chocolate, licorice, some peat and hints of iodine. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty, a bit smoky taste of dark chocolate, hazelnut, some vanilla, peat, iodine and a touch of licorice, followed by a medium long, slightly roasty-bitter, moderately peaty and a little warming finish. Over medium-bodied, smooth and just slightly effervescent mouthfeel, almost flat. Very elegant beer, lovely sipper, and relatively low in alcohol. The whisky flavours merge perfectly with the base beer, it just lacks a bit of body which is not surprising though.
11.2 ounce bottle at home. Very nice beer. Hint of whisky to the nose. Pitch black in color. Very silky smooth. Notes of whiskey in the taste. What an excellent winter warmer

Bottle. Whisky aroma. Very Dark Brown in colour; Reddish against light. Very Malty; roast/burnt malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel, toffee, vanilla, oak. Hints of whisky; salty, peat smoky, oily, tarry. Fruity; vinous, dark fruits. Surprisingly, alcohol is well disguised. Mildly sweet malty leading to a dry mildly bitter roast finish. Lingering smoky aftertaste. Moderately intense flavours; rather subtle; not extreme. Very tasty. Nicely done. Lovely beer! (2009-07)

Pours a viscous-looking, close to black body with a light tan head that sticks to the glass. Strong aroma of dry, bitter and dark chocolate, cocoa powder, wet charcoal, tobacco and dark roasted malt. Strong flavour of dark roasted malt, bitter chocolate, cocoa, leather, wet charcoal, brown sugar and pine bark. The whisky notes are quite well hidden in the back, together with burnt sugar. Moderate sweet taste with a light to moderate bitter long-lasting finish. Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation. A complex and tasty beer with a very well integrated whisky influence, maybe a bit too well integrated. 
[33 cl bottle, bottle number 19836, enjoyed 21 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Ullevål, Oslo]
Bottle. Opaque black, thin head. Rich aroma thats almost wine-y with the fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, chocolate. Its rich and absolutely delicious. Could guzzle it and do myself some damage.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle. Dark malts, some roastiness, lots of whisky, tobacco, vanilla with dried fruits in the back. In taste likewise, semi sweet. Oily texture, medium to full body, finish bit alcoholic with whisky and moderate bitterness.

From bottle thanks to Mads. Pours a clear dark brown with a small off white head. Aroma has toffee, oak, malts, malty whisky, vanilla, tobacco, chocolate, light sweet cherries, port wine. taste is sweet, more chocolate going on here, slight bitter, slight oaky. Low carbonation and an oily body.

Aroma Mainly of a great english porter: cocoa, some roasted malts, some vanilla probably from oxidation after aging. Little bit of alcoholly notes (although none in taste)less whiskey and wood but some whiskey is in the nose, the taste of whiskey and wood is however dominated by classic, very drinkable English porter, with some but not overwhelming roastness of malts. Overall incredibly pleasant, sweet,
it is quiet medium bodied although easy drinkable and still complex. Definitely recommend! Drunk on 06.12.2016 - review typed from notes.

Bottle number 08370. Pours a a pitchblack colour with a small brown head. Aroma of coffee, dark malts, wood, bit of liquorice, roasted malts, chocolate. Taste is medium sweet, soft bitter woth a warming finish. Notes of coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, bit of scotch, liquorice. Texture is watery, medium bodied with low carbonation

this beer pours into darkness, like that one star trek movie, the head is a thin caramel. aroma is rich, filed with chocolate and coffee a winning combination. the flavour is sweet the chocolate and coffee makes an appearance again. a wonderful drink and a big thanks to my secret santa.

En øl der har lagret på whiskey-fade.
Den er sødlig men også fint humlet. Kan måske smage smagen af whiskeyen i eftersmagen. Virkelig godt øl.
207 bottle pours a black color with no head. Aromas of scotch, roasted malt, smoke. Full bodied, very scotch forward, a very nice beer.

Bot no. 58440 date Feb.2012 to Sep.2016
Czarne, piana brązowa, drobna, niska, ale chętnie się tworzy, lekko zdobi szkło. Aromat palony, kawowy, wyraźnie czekoladowy i pełen whisky. W smaku gorzka czekolada, słodycz z nutą kawy. Przyjemnie palone i rozgrzewające na finiszu. Niskie, niemal płaskie nasycenie.

Delicious aromas of oak, dark chocolate, dark coffee, soy, dark malt whiskey. Luscious flavor of oak, dark coffee, dark chocolate, sweet, dark malt whiskey. Celestial good bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Mouth orgasm to more than 100%. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours black, no head. Aroma is malty, roasted, sweet, nice balance. Taate is malty, whiskey, roasted, smoke. Complex, balanced.

Aroma; dark roasted malts, peat, sour prune, peach note, dark fruit peels. Look; diminished beige top, black body. Taste; dark roasted malts, liquorice, peat, black prune, dark caramel - dark caramel liquorice malted finish. Feel; solid body, soft. Overall; tasty sipper. Bought some time ago. Bottled in 2014, so it spent some time with cellaring.

Aroma: sweet, chocolate, caramel with a hint of soy sauce.

Dark brown, almost jet black. Cloudy with almost no head.

Quite heavy on sweetness, medium bitterness.

Medium to full body, almost oily in mouth, flat (no carbonation).

Long, chocolate, bitter finish.

Overall: good, but it could be more intense in all aspects.

- schwarze Farbe mit minimalen Brauntönen
- leichte, schnell zerfallende Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Kaffee, Honig, Toffee, Malz, Lakritz und etwas Rauch
- passende, schön zurückhaltende Carbonisierung
- der Antrunk überraschend schlank und dünn
- bei diesen Aromen, dem Preis und der langen Lagerung erwartet man einfach
 ein anderes Aha-Erlebnis
- vorab, es ist ein gutes Bier, aber mir fehlt einfach die Vielfalt der einzelnen
 Geschmacksnuancen 
- der Körper ist mir zu durchsichtig und zu leer
- im Mittelteil fängt dann zu allem Überfluss noch der Alkohol an, sich in den
 Vordergrund zu drängen
- gegen Ende versöhnt der Abgang noch mit einer schönen Lakritz-Rauch-Note
Fazit: Mehr Schein als Sein

Dégustée avec mon cher Appiantiqua dans nos petits verres Duvel 18cl: belle robe de couleur ébène avec une fine mousse ivoire peu persistante .La carbonatation est intense.Le nez nous offre de bonnes odeurs boisées , des arômes de café avec des notes fumées.La bouche nous amène sur un agréable velouté avec des saveurs de vin cuit apportées par lalcool subtilement présent.Une douceur très plaisante bien associée à une légère amertume.18,5/20

Dégustée avec mon Kittenbieer dans un verre Duvel 18cl.
Température de début environ 10°.
Superbe robe ébène surmontée dune fine mousse ivoire assez persistante; carbonatation intense.
Nez exceptionnel avec des notes de chocolat et de café à lancienne et surtout de très agréables arômes boisés.
Le goût reste sur les mêmes composantes et ajoute des saveurs de vieux porto le tout dans un parfait équilibre douceur/amertume.
La finale est longue et plaisante sur un alcool chaleureux et idéalement intégré.
Une bière particulièrement réussie dans la subtilité.
18,5/20

From 330ml bottle. Black with no head. Looks a bit flat and disappointing. Roast malt and coffee and quite a pronounced whisky taste from the cask. Not my favourite, to be honest

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle. Very dark with a thin tan head. Aroma of leather, coffee, roasted malt. Flavour is similar, with dark fruit and chocolate tones. Good

It pours black with a brown head. It has aromas of whiskey, coffee, vanilla, and dark fruit. It has flavors of roast, whiskey, coffee, vanilla, some dark fruit, and a touch of chocolate. It has a heavy body with a bitter finish. Overall, this has a complex combination of malts with whiskey flavoring that is not overpowering like so many others and a warm alcohol finish.

How: bottle Appearance: almost black, tiny tanned head. Aroma: intense walnut/ hazelnut aroma, cherries, prunes, wood, burnt caramel, raisins, madeira, scotch, some chocholate and spice. Palate: full to medium body, soft carbonation, Superb!
Bottle - pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is ovaltine malt, coffee and a bit of soy sauce. Taste is dry with a cereal malt finish, hints of the cask too. Smooth oily palate.

Bottle. Rich smokey toffee aroma. Porter like dark appearance with a small brownish head. Flavours of roasted coffee, dark chocolate and toffee with some whiskey notes. Slick and sticky texture. Rich malt finish.

Bottle. Teku. Pitch black with very tiny, light brown head, poor head retention and lacing. Mostly rich roasted malts aroma - mainly milk chocolate, coffee also mild wooden notes and moderate vanilla aromas. Whiskey notes are not so striking. Caramel notes somewhere in the background. Taste is rather semi-sweet very characteristic for an imperial porter. This semi-sweetness last very short in the middle it disappears somewhere and taste is rather dull, not very characteristic. Medium to full body, thick to oily texture, average carbonation, finish is semi-dry, ashy and mild. In overall nice, drinkable beer, but the palate and taste are pretty disappointing.

330ml bottle shared with brother, thanks for the share. Aroma: Smokey, roasted malt, coffee, a bit of band aid but really far so doesnt matter much. Whiskey is much present in here. Some rye in there too. App: dark burgundy, small mocha head, little lacing. Taste and palate: light to medium body, great palate, light sweetness, smokey and subtle bitter finish. overall: I like the taste much more the nose. The whiskey is really present and I like it quite a lot in the mouthfeel. Cant wait to drink the 18 years.

Musta olut pienehköllä, pitsiä jättävällä beigellä vaahdolla. Tuoksu hyvin paahteisen maltainen, hieman savuinen, viskimäinen ja puinen, suklainen ja kevyesti kahvinen sekä jopa hieman vaniljainen. Erittäin hieno ja tyylikäs tuoksu kutsuu maistamaan. Maussa viskimäisyys nostaa ehkä enemmän otettaan ja pyrkii isompaan rooliin. Lisäksi vahvaa paahteisuutta, kevyesti savuisuutta, puumaisuutta. Loppupuoleltaan kevyesti kuivattavan katkera. Melko täyteläinen suutuntuma, mutta todella pehmeä kokonaisuus, alkoholi pysyy täysin piilossa. Erinomainen nautiskeluolut toimii parhaiten lämmettyään riittävästi.

Bottle. Oily black, with no head. Aromas of chocolate, deep nutty roast, alcohol, Christmas pudding fruit, whiskey and oak. Luscious mouthfeel, full of dark dark chocolate, heavy malt, alcohol and plenty of smokey, whiskey and wood. Lovely winter sipper.

(33 cl bottle bought for 10 USD @ Mikkeller Bottle Shop; BBD: October 2018; L0510; Bottle #14333; Bottled in April 2015) Poured at fridge temperature into a Maisel & Friends footed tulip glass reveals a pitch black body with two fingers of creamy, tan head that fades somewhat within the first minute yet leaving a foamcap and lace. Aroma has roasted malt and some oxydised sherry notes and a hint of smoke. Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium to full body and a lingering finish. Flavour has sweetness but also lots of aroma complexity. The whisky imprint on this one is quite distinct and pleasant.

Aroma: sherry barrels and oporto, figs, dried fruits.
Appearance: deep amber color and creamy head.
Taste: low herbal bitterness, roasted dark malts, barrels, oporto, figs, bitter chocolate, quite dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, barrel finish.
Overall: Really good stuff, complex barrel aged old ale, nice dried fruits and barrel notes.

Bottle no 24190, Feb 2014. L0503. BB March 2017. Pours darkish brown with a steady, medium in size, beige head that leaves some scattered lace. The aroma is pleasant, alas a bit subdued (till the end), giving off notes of chocolate powdery and roasty malts and (cheapish) whisky; tastes likewise with sweet chocolaty notes most dominant, and the slightly salty whisky playing second fiddle. In the finish the whisky is not too convincing, feels a bit like those chocolate sweets with a drop of whisky inside.. Soft on the palate, with thin and modest carbonation. Overall... doesnt seem as multilayered and enjoyable, say, compared to the 16 YO I had nearly two years ago (and probably rated a bit too optimistically at 4.2), or other BA brews that Ive had in the meantime. It is very good though, but I hope the 18 YO will be a lot better.

I really liked the others in this series but this one was rather disappointing. +++ Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a black color with a medium sized foamy beige head that left decent lacing. The aroma was sweetish and malty with notes of caramel, molasses, whiskey and a touch of chocolate. The flavor was bitter and malty with wood and whiskey notes. Long finish. Moderately full bodied. Ok.
Bottle. Black with beige head. Aroma of whisky, dried fruits, roasted. Sweet malt flavour, chocolate, alcohol warming at the the end
Bottle from LeeAVFC cheers mate; dark opaque brown pour thin light tan head, aroma has chocolate, light roast and a hint of spirit, taste has sweet chocolate, dirty roast, some barrel, dark fruits.
Bottle.Black colour with no head.Aroma of vanilla and wood.Taste is mild of whisky and coffee,smooth oily mouthfeels and soft carbonation,full body and soft finish.
Black oily pour with zero head. Very low carbonation. Nice smell of whiskey barrel but not real volatile. Dark roast taste. Nice. More porter style than what I typically think of as old ale.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of peats, light coffee and chocolate, hints of toffee and caramel. Taste is sweet, mild caramel, light booze, German sausage. Body is medium full and smooth with soft carbonation.
Got it for $8.31 for one 12 Oz bottle. It was worth the price. Wow. Its an imperial stout with a scotchy finish. very good blend of the chocolate and coffee too.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2017 Ive just drunk a bottle of this and Im still not sure what to make of it inky back minimal head like an English strong ale with stout like qualites.  peat tar leather caramel a strange array of flavours interesting beer the whisky influence is prominent
Bottle - Dark pour with an average tan head. Light coffee aroma, nuts and a woodsy whiskey taste. Also has some stout overtones to it. This a good beer!

Pours a murky black with a barely there tan head. Aroma is of roasted malt, whiskey, wood, vanilla, dark chocolate, and coconut. Tastes of burnt coffee, roasted malts, whisky and wood. Has a watery body with low carbonation. Kind of oily and very warming.

Cola black beer with a dark beige head. A little roastiness and red berries on the nose. Medium bitterness. Quite mild aroma at first but builds up towards the after taste. At first it has this medium, dry roastiness and then suddenly builds up to a lot sweeter and thicker flavor. At first its velvety smooth and later it becomes a little more harsh yet still keeping everything in balance. This is something quite unique and beautiful.
Bottle shared with dusty and brian....thought it would have been better...smokey malts...some berries but just ok flavor...needed more...(#811)

On cask at the Ginger Man, Manhattan. 

Ive had virtually all of the Ola Dubh family in bottles over the years. This is my first having any of them on cask. Man, what an awesome surprise. Mouthfeel is creamy, surprising to me for "only" an 8 abv. Smell is dried fruit. But the taste...caramel, dried fruit...it really blew me away. Gosh, I want more of this on cask. Really an unexpected taste treat on cask. Bravo to the brewers. Bartender...

Bottle; pours nearly black with a beige head; sweet aroma of caramel with some vanilla, wood, and malt; taste is sweet with caramel, malt, vanilla, and hints of wood; finish is dry with a touch of wood and whiskey; real nice beer

Dark with minamal head. Reach aroma of chocolate and nuts, vanilla and peat. Flavour the same with oak notes. Really nice with HP wisky (not as mix, but ome after another). Long roasty malty aftertaste.

330ml bottle served in snifter glass. Purchased at Drinks of the World - Geveva.
A: Pours a dark brown to black color forming a medium beige head with medium to low retention and some few spotty lacings left in the glass.
S: Strong notes of sweet caramel, roasted malts, whisky and wood, mainly. A bit boozy. Hints of vanilla and licorice. Light notes of leather and earth.
T: Sweet upfront taste. Strong notes of caramel and roasted malts. Notes of whisky, oak, vanilla and licorice. In overall, the taste is sweet and slightly bitter. Light notes of grassy hops.
M: Heavy body. Medium to low carbonation. Sweet caramel, whisky and oak in the aftertaste.
O: Excellent drinkability. Less whiskey than the 16 version. More caramel and roasted malts. Classic British Old Ale.

Strangely satisfying. I expected more flavors out of this, but its the smoothness that gives this beer all its merit. Light toasted aromas. Weak head and adequate carbonation. Very dark. Quite complex in mouth. High alcohol content not perceptible, so very well balanced.
Wow - an amazing beer. Smokiness comes through first. You can definitely taste the whiskey. Pours very black. A good sweetness in the flavour as well. Goes so well with steak.

Pours very dark brown with good beige head. Nose is initially metallic and woody settling down to chocolate and heavily roasted barley, slight phenols coming through. Taste is better than the aroma, smooth and rich on the body with initial hit of malt and chocolate tastes developing into slight coffee, raisins and oak. The finish is not as long as I thought it would be but there is a touch of peat phenols amongst cocoa.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are dark fruit, smoke, oak, and some whiskey.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 Bottle 330ml (2014) - cellared for 2 years. Served at room temperature. Pours jet black. Head is small, tanned, dense and lasts very well. Aroma is rich and complex with notes of roasted barley, dates, figs, dark cherry chocolate, burnt toffee, treacle, tobacco, peated whisky and smokey oak. Flavour is a light earthy bitterness with notes of roasted barley, raisins, dried currants, dried cherries, toffee, dark chocolate, aniseed, peated whisky, some spice and a strong smokey/charred, woody finish. Full bodied with light carbonation, oily texture and a very long, complex oaky finish. Incredible Old Ale!!!

Bottle @Bir&Fud Bottega (Rome). Pours oily black with a medium head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate notes with light mocha and a touch of peated whisky. Flavour is medium sweet with a good bitter end, smoky aftertaste. High body, medium carbonation. Close to world class!
UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 Mørk i utseendet, med lavt lyst brunt skum. Mild aroma av bål, lær og kaffe. Smaken er tobakk, røyk, kaffe, whiskey, lakris og mildt av vanilje. Herlig fløyelsmyk konsistens.
Aroma intenso do malte torrado e com notas leves de whisky. O sabor também deixa uma leve percepção do whisky. Cor preta e espuma marrom. Paladar singular, ótima sensação!
Black with thin creamy head. Aroma and flavour have sticking plasters, light smoke, leather, bitter roasted malts, some coffee and of course malt whisky.

Denne ola dubh har et mørkt udseende med et svagt hvidt skum. Øllen har en whisky og træ aroma og smager deraf med både noter af chokolade, lakrids og lidt kaffe. God cremet fornemmelse. Lav karbonering.

Aroma of roasty chocolate and coffee with hints of liquirice and whisky. Black with a nice small white head. Medium sweetness followed by a medium bitter and dry finish. Soft carbonation, medium body and creamy texture. Great ale!
Bottle with the Belgrade Boys at Halloween tasting. Same heavy pour with soapy head. Rich barrel aroma, deep vanilla. Smoky, woody overtones. Creamier body, lots of whiskey. Solid, tasty.

Like any good grandad: Liquorice Allsorts, a smokey/tobacco whiff; whisky everywhere  and something youll never fully understand. Ill stop the analogy there. Seriously good, and worth whatever high price you pay for it. Body is perfect weight; long whiskyfied finish is inviting.

Bottle. Amazing nose, with rich dark fruit, light smoke, licorice, barrel, and light alc. fumes. Thick dark brown color with translucent edges. Whisky barrel flavor, with smoke, dark fruit, berries, The fruitiness and the barrel notes blend wonderfully in the finish. Decided alcohol presence. Medium-heavy body (a bit thin for the style). Very smooth, flavors are full but subtle, gentle, and complex.
Black with tan head. Freshly emptied whiskey barrels, tobacco, some smoke and tar. Dry, fruity, some metal, Sweet caramel, floral and vanilla finish. Overall: excellent balance. Great whiskey old ale

Flasche (33 cl) vom Bierzwerg-Onlineversand. - Tiefschwarz, schwacher dunkelbeigefarbener Schaum. - In der Nase schweres dunkles Malz, Stout-artig, mit zarten Anklängen an Vanille und Torfrauch. - Antrunk schwer und füllig röstmalzig mit starkem Mokka und weicher, zurückhaltender Süße. Beim Wärmerwerden zeigen sich zarte komplexe Säure und Noten von Torf. Mild rezent, weich im Mund, schwer aber nicht sirupartig. Im Abgang milde, schwach holzige Herbe mit einem Hauch von Asche, zart salzig. Im Nachtrunk dann tatsächlich so etwas wie Whisky-Noten: zart torfig und rauchig. - Schmeckt wie ein erstklassiges schweres Stout, dabei rund und sehr harmonisch. Die Whisky-Noten geben ihm nur noch das besondere Etwas.

Bottle 0.33l at The Halloween tasting 2015 Belgrade Serbia.Taste at Beerville Bar with our small tasting group.Bro Vlada, Bro Alberto and Bro Matt.Bottle from the Great British festival.Pour it dark thick color with small white head.Aroma of whiskey, wooden barrel. Taste of vanilla, whiskey present, spice, smooth, milky texture, nice balanced, for me the best from this series.

Bottle shared with with TO at Melkebaren 19.12.15. Ebony. Small, brown head. Sweet aroma and taste of dark malt, dried dark berries, dark syrup and dried red fruits. A a hint of dark caramel and burnt sugar.

Black body, tiny lasting brown head. Appealing aroma, lots of malt complexity, coffee, dark chocolate, wood, vanilla, berries. Taste as complex, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, wood, liquorice. Long whisky barrel finish, some bitterness.  Full body, low carbo. So good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @home. Pours with a dark brown colour, medium sized brown head. Aroma is medium to heavy malty, with notes of woodberries and, more in the background, coffe, dark chocolate and vanilla; medium hoppy; additional distinct notes of whisky. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. A good brew overall, but I would have preferred it less hoppy.
Bottle. Color dark brown with small head. Aroma malt, roasted, chocolate. Taste sweet, roasted, dark chocolate, dry, alcohol.
Tasting at Mrks. Mooi soepel en gebalanceerd, drinkt zoals je een goede wijn drinkt ofzo.. Backlog from 2014/12/27.

An old ale aged in whiskey casks, you say? Color me intrigued. And color the beer itself a nearly impenetrably black, though a lift up to the lights does reveal the faintest streaks of brilliant crimson. Scotchy scotch scotch. The aroma is a celebration of the spirit, balanced with notes of dark chocolate as well as some sweeter fruity esters: currants, plums. A slight alcohol burn is also there, but its muted and blended nicely. Id say the scotch is even more subdued in the flavor than in the nose, but this isnt necessarily a bad thing. In fact, in interacts very well with the a heavy dark fruit sweetness. Amazing coffee notes from the malt hit at the finish and linger in the back of the throat for a while after the swallow. The mouthfeel seems to be the only downside to this beer. You would expect a brew whose name translates to "black oil" to be a little more viscous. The liquid feels creamy, sure, but a little more body would be appreciated. However, I could (and intend to) sip this for the next hour.
